education_text.0: Clyde Lee Giles is an American computer scientist and the David Reese Professor at the College of Information Sciences and Technology (IST) at the      Pennsylvania State University Pennsylvania State UniversityClyde Lee Giles is an American computer scientist and the David Reese Professor at the College of Information Sciences and Technology (IST) at the      Pennsylvania State University Pennsylvania State UniversityGiles has been associated with the computer science or electrical engineering departments at      Princeton University Princeton University, the      University of Pennsylvania University of Pennsylvania,      Columbia University Columbia University, the      University of Pisa University of Pisa, the      University of Trento University of Trento and the      University of Maryland, College Park University of Maryland, College ParkHis research interests are in intelligent web and cyberinfrastructure tools, search engines and information retrieval, digital libraries, web services, knowledge and information management and extraction, machine learning, and information and data miningHis research interests are in intelligent web and cyberinfrastructure tools, search engines and information retrieval, digital libraries, web services, knowledge and information management and extraction, machine learning, and information and data miningHis research interests are in intelligent web and cyberinfrastructure tools, search engines and information retrieval, digital libraries, web services, knowledge and information management and extraction, machine learning, and information and data miningHe is the director of the Next Generation CiteSeer project,      CiteSeerX, also at the      Pennsylvania State University Pennsylvania State UniversityResearch in collaboration with Professors Prasenjit Mitra, Karl Mueller, Barbara Garrison and James Kubicki resulted in the development of a search engine and data portal for chemistry, Chemsubx
